required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Open Label Study of Sildenafil in Patients With Pulmonary Arterial Hypertension
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3, Multi-Center, Open-Label Study to Assess Safety and Efficacy of Sildenafil Citrate 20 mg TID in Subjects With Pulmonary Arterial Hypertension

brief_summary.textblock: To assess the safety of sildenafil 20 mg TID orally given to Japanese pulmonary arterial hypertension patients (Part 1 and 2) To assess the efficacy after 12 weeks of treatment of sildenafil 20 mg TID orally given to Japanese pulmonary arterial hypertension patients (Part 1)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in the 6-minute Walk Distance From Baseline at Week 12 in Participants Who Entered the Study From Part I
primary_outcome.description: Change：6-minute walk distance at Week 12 minus 6-minute walk distance at baseline. The 6-minute walk distance:total distance walked during the 6-minute walk test.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in the Mean Pulmonary Arterial Pressure From Baseline at Week 12 in Participants Who Entered the Study From Part I
primary_outcome.description: Change:Mean pulmonary arterial pressure at Week 12 minus mean pulmonary arterial pressure at baseline.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in the Pulmonary Vascular Resistance From Baseline at Week 12 in Participants Who Entered the Study From Part I
primary_outcome.description: Change：Pulmonary vascular resistance at Week 12 minus pulmonary vascular resistance at baseline

primary_outcome.measure: Change in the Cardiac Output From Baseline at Week 12 in Participants Who Entered the Study From Part I
primary_outcome.description: Change：Cardiac output at Week 12 minus cardiac output at baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the 6-minute Walk Distance From Baseline at Week 8 in Participants Who Entered the Study From Part I
secondary_outcome.description: Change：6-minute walk distance at Week 8 minus 6-minute walk distance at baseline. The 6-minute walk distance:Total distance walked during the 6- minute walk test.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the Systolic Pulmonary Arterial Pressure From Baseline at Week 12 in Participants Who Entered the Study From Part I
secondary_outcome.description: Change：Systolic pulmonary arterial pressure at Week 12 minus Systolic pulmonary arterial pressure at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the Diastolic Pulmonary Arterial Pressure From Baseline at Week 12 in Participants Who Entered the Study From Part I
secondary_outcome.description: Change：Diastolic pulmonary arterial pressure at Week 12 minus diastolic pulmonary arterial pressure at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the Systolic Systemic Blood Pressure From Baseline at Week 12 in Participants Who Entered the Study From Part I
secondary_outcome.description: Change：Systolic systemic blood pressure at Week 12 minus systolic systemic blood pressure at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the Diastolic Systemic Blood Pressure From Baseline at Week 12 in Participants Who Entered the Study From Part I
secondary_outcome.description: Change：Diastolic systemic blood pressure at Week 12 minus diastolic systemic blood pressure at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the Mean Systemic Blood Pressure From Baseline at Week 12 in Participants Who Entered the Study From Part I
secondary_outcome.description: Mean systemic blood pressure:diastolic blood pressure+(systolic blood pressure-diastolic blood pressure)/3. Change：Mean systemic blood pressure at Week 12 minus mean systemic blood pressure at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the Pulmonary Capillary Wedge Pressure From Baseline at Week 12 in Participants Who Entered the Study From Part I
secondary_outcome.description: Change：Pulmonary capillary wedge pressure at Week 12 minus pulmonary capillary wedge pressure at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the Right Atrial Pressure From Baseline at Week 12 in Participants Who Entered the Study From Part I
secondary_outcome.description: Change：Right atrial pressure at Week 12 minus right atrial pressure at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the Cardiac Index From Baseline at Week 12 in Participants Who Entered the Study From Part I
secondary_outcome.description: Change：Cardiac index at Week 12 minus cardiac index at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the Heart Rate From Baseline at Week 12 in Participants Who Entered the Study From Part I
secondary_outcome.description: Change：Heart rate at Week 12 minus heart rate at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the Pulmonary Vascular Resistance Index From Baseline at Week 12 in Participants Who Entered the Study From Part I
secondary_outcome.description: Change:Pulmonary vascular resistance index at Week 12 minus pulmonary vascular resistance index at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the Systemic Vascular Resistance From Baseline at Week 12 in Participants Who Entered the Study From Part I
secondary_outcome.description: Change：Systemic vascular resistance at Week 12 minus systemic vascular resistance at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the Systemic Vascular Resistance Index From Baseline at Week 12 in Participants Who Entered the Study From Part I
secondary_outcome.description: Change：Systemic vascular resistance index at Week 12 minus systemic vascular resistance index at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the Mixed Venous Oxygen Saturation From Baseline at Week 12 in Participants Who Entered the Study From Part I
secondary_outcome.description: Change：Mixed venous oxygen saturation at Week 12 minus mixed venous oxygen saturation at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the Arterial Oxygen Saturation From Baseline at Week 12 in Participants Who Entered the Study From Part I
secondary_outcome.description: Change：Arterial oxygen saturation at Week 12 minus arterial oxygen saturation at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the Arterial Oxygen Partial Pressure From Baseline at Week 12 in Participants Who Entered the Study From Part I
secondary_outcome.description: Change：Arterial oxygen partial pressure at Week 12 minus arterial oxygen partial pressure at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the Partial Pressure of Mixed Venous Oxygen From Baseline at Week 12 in Participants Who Entered the Study From Part I
secondary_outcome.description: Change：Partial pressure of mixed venous oxygen at Week 12 minus partial pressure of mixed venous oxygen at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the World Health Organization (WHO) Functional Class of Pulmonary Arterial Hypertension From Baseline at Weeks 12 in Participants Who Entered the Study From Part I
secondary_outcome.description: The cross-tabulation table on the WHO functional classes of pulmonary arterial hypertension at baseline and Week 12. The WHO functional classes of pulmonary arterial hypertension:Class I (pulmonary arterial hypertension patients with no limitation in physical activity) to Class IV (pulmonary arterial hypertension patients who can not perform a physical activity without any symptoms).

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the BORG Dyspnoea Score From Baseline at Week 8 and Week 12 in Participants Who Entered the Study From Part I
secondary_outcome.description: Change：BORG dyspnoea score at Week 8 and Week 12 minus BORG dyspnoea score at baseline. BORG dyspnoea score:Scale 0 (no breathlessness at all) to 10 (maximum). The score reflected the maximum degree of dyspnoea that the participants experienced at any time during the 6-minute walk distance.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the the Plasma Brain Natriuretic Peptide Level From Baseline at Week 4, Week 8 and Week 12 in Participants Who Entered the Study From Part I
secondary_outcome.description: Change：Plasma brain natriuretic peptide level at Week 4, Week 8 and Week 12 minus plasma brain natriuretic peptide level at baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the 6-minute Walk Distance From Baseline at Week 12 in Participants Who Newly Entered the Study From Part II
secondary_outcome.description: Change：6-minute walk distance at Week 12 minus 6-minute walk distance at baseline. The 6-minute walk distance:Total distance walked during the 6- minute walk test.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the World Health Organization (WHO) Functional Class From Baseline at Week 12 in Participants Who Newly Entered the Study From Part II
secondary_outcome.description: The cross-tabulation table on the WHO functional classes of pulmonary arterial hypertension at baseline and Week 12. The WHO functional classes of pulmonary arterial hypertension:Class I (pulmonary arterial hypertension patients with no limitation in physical activity) to Class IV (pulmonary arterial hypertension patients who can not perform a physical activity without any symptoms).

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the BORG Dyspnoea Score From Baseline at Week 12 in Participants Who Newly Entered the Study From Part II
secondary_outcome.description: Change：BORG dyspnoea score at Week 12 minus BORG dyspnoea score at baseline. BORG dyspnoea score:Scale 0 (no breathlessness at all) to 10 (maximum). The score reflected the maximum degree of dyspnoea that the participants experienced at any time during the 6-minute walk distance.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the the Plasma Brain Natriuretic Peptide Level From Baseline at Week 12 in Participants Who Newly Enterd the Study From Part II
secondary_outcome.description: Change：Plasma brain natriuretic peptide level at Week 12 minus plasma brain natriuretic peptide level at baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum Plasma Concentrations (Cmax) of Sildenafil and Sildenafil's Metabolite, UK-103,320
secondary_outcome.description: Maximum plasma concentrations was calculated from the observed value of plasma concentrations in each participant

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to First Occurrence of Maximum Plasma Concentrations (Tmax) of Sildenafil and Sildenafil's Metabolite, UK-103,320
secondary_outcome.description: Time to first occurrence of maximum plasma concentrations were calculated from the observed value of plasma concentrations in each participant.

secondary_outcome.measure: The Area Under the Curve (AUC) From Time 0 to Time 8 Hour of Sildenafil and Sildenafil's Metabolite, UK-103,320
secondary_outcome.description: The area under the curve from time 0 to time 8 hour was calculated from area under the curve in each perticipant on the date of blood sampling using the linear/log trapezoidal rule

secondary_outcome.measure: The Average Plasma Concentration (Css,av) of Sildenafil at Steady State
secondary_outcome.description: The average plasma concentration of sildenafil at steady state was calculated from the area under the curve from time 0 to 8 hour/dosing interval (8 hours).

secondary_outcome.measure: The Average Plasma Trough Concentration (Ctrough) of Sildenafil
secondary_outcome.description: The average plasma trough concentration of sildenafil was calculated from the observed value before administration of the drug in each participants.

secondary_outcome.measure: Laboratory Test Abnormalities (Without Regard to Baseline Abnormality)
secondary_outcome.description: The total number of participants with laboratory test abnormalities without regard to baseline abnormality.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects aged 16 and over, and classified as having pulmonary arterial hypertension
- Subjects who meet the following conditions on right heart catheterization at screening or baseline: mean pulmonary arterial pressure of ≥ 25mmHg and pulmonary capillary wedge pressure of ≤ 15mmHg at rest
- Subjects whose baseline 6-Minute Walk test distance is >100 m and <450 m
Exclusion Criteria:
- Significant Hepatic and/or renal disorder
- Subjects with known hereditary degenerative retinal disorders (such as retinitis pigmentosa) or history of non-arteritic ischemic optic neuropathy (NAION)
- Subjects who are currently receiving nitrates or nitric oxide donors in any form, ritonavir, ketoconazole and itraconazole

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Twenty-one pulmonary arterial hypertension patients who have never received sildenafil therapy entered the study from Part I period and could continue to study part II period. Twenty-three patients who were continuously using sildenafil entered the study from Part II period.

group.title: Sildenafil: Participant Who Entered the Study From Part I
group.description: Consists of participants who entered the study from Part I period in Week 0. The participants were treated with sildenafil 20 mg three times a day orally in Part I period (12 weeks) and Part II period (long-term treatment period, until a proper system was established to provide sildenafil to participants after approval for the indication of pulmonary arterial hypertension).

group.title: Sildenafil: Participants Who Entered the Study From Part II
group.description: Consists of participants who newly entered the study from Part II period in Week 0. The participants were treated with sildenafil 20 mg three times a day orally in Part II period (long-term treatment period, until a proper system was established to provide sildenafil to subjects after approval for the indication of pulmonary arterial hypertension).

participants_list.participants: 19 participants completed Part I period. 17 of 19 participants continued from part I into Part II.

group.description: Consists of participants who newly entered the study from Part II period in Week 0. The participants were treated with sildenafil 20 mg three times a day orally in Part II period (long-term treatment period, until a proper system was established to provide sildenafil to subjects after approval for the indication of pulmonary arterial hypertension).

The participants were treated with sildenafil 20 mg three times a day orally in Part I period (12 weeks) and Part II period (long-term treatment period, until a proper system was established to provide sildenafil to participants after approval for the indication of pulmonary arterial hypertension).

measure.title: Change in the Systemic Vascular Resistance Index From Baseline at Week 12 in Participants Who Entered the Study From Part I
measure.description: Change：Systemic vascular resistance index at Week 12 minus systemic vascular resistance index at baseline.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set, including participants who took at least one dose of study medication and had efficacy measurements at both baseline and post-baseline. Last observation carried forward.

outcome.title: Change in the Mixed Venous Oxygen Saturation From Baseline at Week 12 in Participants Who Entered the Study From Part I
outcome.description: Change：Mixed venous oxygen saturation at Week 12 minus mixed venous oxygen saturation at baseline.
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set, including participants who took at least one dose of study medication and had efficacy measurements at both baseline and post-baseline. Last observation carried forward.

group.title: Sildenafil:Part I
group.description: Consists of participants who entered the study from Part I period in Week 0. The participants were treated with sildenafil 20 mg three times a day orally in Part I period (12 weeks) and Part II period (long-term treatment period, until a proper system was established to provide sildenafil to participants after approval for the indication of pulmonary arterial hypertension).

measure.title: Change in the Mixed Venous Oxygen Saturation From Baseline at Week 12 in Participants Who Entered the Study From Part I
measure.description: Change：Mixed venous oxygen saturation at Week 12 minus mixed venous oxygen saturation at baseline.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set, including participants who took at least one dose of study medication and had efficacy measurements at both baseline and post-baseline. Last observation carried forward.

outcome.title: Change in the Arterial Oxygen Saturation From Baseline at Week 12 in Participants Who Entered the Study From Part I
outcome.description: Change：Arterial oxygen saturation at Week 12 minus arterial oxygen saturation at baseline.
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set, including participants who took at least one dose of study medication and had efficacy measurements at both baseline and post-baseline. Last observation carried forward.

group.title: Sildenafil:Part I
group.description: Consists of participants who entered the study from Part I period in Week 0. The participants were treated with sildenafil 20 mg three times a day orally in Part I period (12 weeks) and Part II period (long-term treatment period, until a proper system was established to provide sildenafil to participants after approval for the indication of pulmonary arterial hypertension).

measure.title: Change in the Arterial Oxygen Saturation From Baseline at Week 12 in Participants Who Entered the Study From Part I
measure.description: Change：Arterial oxygen saturation at Week 12 minus arterial oxygen saturation at baseline.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set, including participants who took at least one dose of study medication and had efficacy measurements at both baseline and post-baseline. Last observation carried forward.

outcome.title: Change in the Arterial Oxygen Partial Pressure From Baseline at Week 12 in Participants Who Entered the Study From Part I
outcome.description: Change：Arterial oxygen partial pressure at Week 12 minus arterial oxygen partial pressure at baseline.
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set, including participants who took at least one dose of study medication and had efficacy measurements at both baseline and post-baseline. Last observation carried forward.

group.title: Sildenafil:Part I
group.description: Consists of participants who entered the study from Part I period in Week 0. The participants were treated with sildenafil 20 mg three times a day orally in Part I period (12 weeks) and Part II period (long-term treatment period, until a proper system was established to provide sildenafil to participants after approval for the indication of pulmonary arterial hypertension).

measure.title: Change in the Arterial Oxygen Partial Pressure From Baseline at Week 12 in Participants Who Entered the Study From Part I
measure.description: Change：Arterial oxygen partial pressure at Week 12 minus arterial oxygen partial pressure at baseline.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set, including participants who took at least one dose of study medication and had efficacy measurements at both baseline and post-baseline. Last observation carried forward.

outcome.title: Change in the Partial Pressure of Mixed Venous Oxygen From Baseline at Week 12 in Participants Who Entered the Study From Part I
outcome.description: Change：Partial pressure of mixed venous oxygen at Week 12 minus partial pressure of mixed venous oxygen at baseline.
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set, including participants who took at least one dose of study medication and had efficacy measurements at both baseline and post-baseline. Last observation carried forward.

group.title: Sildenafil:Part I
group.description: Consists of participants who entered the study from Part I period in Week 0. The participants were treated with sildenafil 20 mg three times a day orally in Part I period (12 weeks) and Part II period (long-term treatment period, until a proper system was established to provide sildenafil to participants after approval for the indication of pulmonary arterial hypertension).

measure.title: Change in the Partial Pressure of Mixed Venous Oxygen From Baseline at Week 12 in Participants Who Entered the Study From Part I
measure.description: Change：Partial pressure of mixed venous oxygen at Week 12 minus partial pressure of mixed venous oxygen at baseline.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set, including participants who took at least one dose of study medication and had efficacy measurements at both baseline and post-baseline. Last observation carried forward.

outcome.title: Changes in the World Health Organization (WHO) Functional Class of Pulmonary Arterial Hypertension From Baseline at Weeks 12 in Participants Who Entered the Study From Part I
outcome.description: The cross-tabulation table on the WHO functional classes of pulmonary arterial hypertension at baseline and Week 12. The WHO functional classes of pulmonary arterial hypertension:Class I (pulmonary arterial hypertension patients with no limitation in physical activity) to Class IV (pulmonary arterial hypertension patients who can not perform a physical activity without any symptoms).
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set, including participants who took at least one dose of study medication and had efficacy measurements at both baseline and post-baseline. Last observation carried forward.

group.title: Sildenafil:Part I , Functional Class at Baseline: I
group.description: Consists of participants who entered the study from Part I period in Week 0, and whose WHO functional class at baseline were I. The participants were treated with sildenafil 20 mg three times a day orally in Part I period (12 weeks) and Part II period (long-term treatment period, until a proper system was established to provide sildenafil to participants after approval for the indication of pulmonary arterial hypertension).

group.title: Sildenafil:Part I, Functional Class at Baseline: II
group.description: Consists of participants who entered the study from Part I period in Week 0, and whose WHO functional class at baseline were II. The participants were treated with sildenafil 20 mg three times a day orally in Part I period (12 weeks) and Part II period (long-term treatment period, until a proper system was established to provide sildenafil to participants after approval for the indication of pulmonary arterial hypertension).

group.title: Sildenafil, Part I, Functional Class at Baseline: III
group.description: Consists of participants who entered the study from Part I period in Week 0, and whose WHO functional class at baseline were III. The participants were treated with sildenafil 20 mg three times a day orally in Part I period (12 weeks) and Part II period (long-term treatment period, until a proper system was established to provide sildenafil to participants after approval for the indication of pulmonary arterial hypertension).

group.title: Sildenafil, Part I, Functional Class at Baseline:IV
group.description: Consists of participants who entered the study from Part I period in Week 0, and whose WHO functional class at baseline were IV. The participants were treated with sildenafil 20 mg three times a day orally in Part I period (12 weeks) and Part II period (long-term treatment period, until a proper system was established to provide sildenafil to participants after approval for the indication of pulmonary arterial hypertension).

measure.title: Changes in the World Health Organization (WHO) Functional Class of Pulmonary Arterial Hypertension From Baseline at Weeks 12 in Participants Who Entered the Study From Part I
measure.description: The cross-tabulation table on the WHO functional classes of pulmonary arterial hypertension at baseline and Week 12. The WHO functional classes of pulmonary arterial hypertension:Class I (pulmonary arterial hypertension patients with no limitation in physical activity) to Class IV (pulmonary arterial hypertension patients who can not perform a physical activity without any symptoms).
measure.population: Full Analysis Set, including participants who took at least one dose of study medication and had efficacy measurements at both baseline and post-baseline. Last observation carried forward.

outcome.title: Changes in the BORG Dyspnoea Score From Baseline at Week 8 and Week 12 in Participants Who Entered the Study From Part I
outcome.description: Change：BORG dyspnoea score at Week 8 and Week 12 minus BORG dyspnoea score at baseline. BORG dyspnoea score:Scale 0 (no breathlessness at all) to 10 (maximum). The score reflected the maximum degree of dyspnoea that the participants experienced at any time during the 6-minute walk distance.
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set, including participants who took at least one dose of study medication and had efficacy measurements at both baseline and post-baseline. Last observation carried forward (Week 12).

group.title: Sildenafil:Part I
group.description: Consists of participants who entered the study from Part I period in Week 0. The participants were treated with sildenafil 20 mg three times a day orally in Part I period (12 weeks) and Part II period (long-term treatment period, until a proper system was established to provide sildenafil to participants after approval for the indication of pulmonary arterial hypertension).

measure.title: Changes in the BORG Dyspnoea Score From Baseline at Week 8 and Week 12 in Participants Who Entered the Study From Part I
measure.description: Change：BORG dyspnoea score at Week 8 and Week 12 minus BORG dyspnoea score at baseline. BORG dyspnoea score:Scale 0 (no breathlessness at all) to 10 (maximum). The score reflected the maximum degree of dyspnoea that the participants experienced at any time during the 6-minute walk distance.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set, including participants who took at least one dose of study medication and had efficacy measurements at both baseline and post-baseline. Last observation carried forward (Week 12).

outcome.title: Changes in the the Plasma Brain Natriuretic Peptide Level From Baseline at Week 4, Week 8 and Week 12 in Participants Who Entered the Study From Part I
outcome.description: Change：Plasma brain natriuretic peptide level at Week 4, Week 8 and Week 12 minus plasma brain natriuretic peptide level at baseline
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set, including participants who took at least one dose of study medication and had efficacy measurements at both baseline and post-baseline. Last observation carried forward (Week 12).

group.title: Sildenafil:Part I
group.description: Consists of participants who entered the study from Part I period in Week 0. The participants were treated with sildenafil 20 mg three times a day orally in Part I period (12 weeks) and Part II period (long-term treatment period, until a proper system was established to provide sildenafil to participants after approval for the indication of pulmonary arterial hypertension).

measure.title: Changes in the the Plasma Brain Natriuretic Peptide Level From Baseline at Week 4, Week 8 and Week 12 in Participants Who Entered the Study From Part I
measure.description: Change：Plasma brain natriuretic peptide level at Week 4, Week 8 and Week 12 minus plasma brain natriuretic peptide level at baseline
measure.population: Full Analysis Set, including participants who took at least one dose of study medication and had efficacy measurements at both baseline and post-baseline. Last observation carried forward (Week 12).

outcome.title: Change in the 6-minute Walk Distance From Baseline at Week 12 in Participants Who Newly Entered the Study From Part II
outcome.description: Change：6-minute walk distance at Week 12 minus 6-minute walk distance at baseline. The 6-minute walk distance:Total distance walked during the 6- minute walk test.
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set, including participants who took at least one dose of study medication and had efficacy measurements at both baseline and post-baseline. Last observation carried forward.

group.title: Sildenafil:Part II
group.description: Consists of participants who newly entered the study from Part II period in Week 0 and had been receiving sildenafil at doses higher than 60 mg/day before the start of this study. The participants were treated with sildenafil 20 mg three times a day orally in Part II period (long-term treatment period, until a proper system was established to provide sildenafil to participants after approval for the indication of pulmonary arterial hypertension).

measure.title: Change in the 6-minute Walk Distance From Baseline at Week 12 in Participants Who Newly Entered the Study From Part II
measure.description: Change：6-minute walk distance at Week 12 minus 6-minute walk distance at baseline. The 6-minute walk distance:Total distance walked during the 6- minute walk test.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set, including participants who took at least one dose of study medication and had efficacy measurements at both baseline and post-baseline. Last observation carried forward.

outcome.title: Change in the World Health Organization (WHO) Functional Class From Baseline at Week 12 in Participants Who Newly Entered the Study From Part II
outcome.description: The cross-tabulation table on the WHO functional classes of pulmonary arterial hypertension at baseline and Week 12. The WHO functional classes of pulmonary arterial hypertension:Class I (pulmonary arterial hypertension patients with no limitation in physical activity) to Class IV (pulmonary arterial hypertension patients who can not perform a physical activity without any symptoms).
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set, including participants who took at least one dose of study medication and had efficacy measurements at both baseline and post-baseline. Last observation carried forward.

group.title: Sildenafil:Part II, Functional Class at Baseline: I

The participants had been receiving sildenafil at doses higher than 60 mg/day before the start of this study.The participants were treated with sildenafil 20 mg three times a day orally in Part II period (long-term treatment period, until a proper system was established to provide sildenafil to participants after approval for the indication of pulmonary arterial hypertension).

measure.title: Changes in the BORG Dyspnoea Score From Baseline at Week 12 in Participants Who Newly Entered the Study From Part II
measure.description: Change：BORG dyspnoea score at Week 12 minus BORG dyspnoea score at baseline. BORG dyspnoea score:Scale 0 (no breathlessness at all) to 10 (maximum). The score reflected the maximum degree of dyspnoea that the participants experienced at any time during the 6-minute walk distance.

outcome.title: Changes in the the Plasma Brain Natriuretic Peptide Level From Baseline at Week 12 in Participants Who Newly Enterd the Study From Part II
outcome.description: Change：Plasma brain natriuretic peptide level at Week 12 minus plasma brain natriuretic peptide level at baseline
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set, including participants who took at least one dose of study medication and had efficacy measurements at both baseline and post-baseline. Last observation carried forward.

group.title: Sildenafil:Part II
group.description: Consists of participants who newly entered the study from Part II period in Week 0 and had been receiving sildenafil at doses higher than 60 mg/day before the start of this study.The participants were treated with sildenafil 20 mg three times a day orally in Part II period (long-term treatment period, until a proper system was established to provide sildenafil to participants after approval for the indication of pulmonary arterial hypertension).

measure.title: Changes in the the Plasma Brain Natriuretic Peptide Level From Baseline at Week 12 in Participants Who Newly Enterd the Study From Part II
measure.description: Change：Plasma brain natriuretic peptide level at Week 12 minus plasma brain natriuretic peptide level at baseline
measure.population: Full Analysis Set, including participants who took at least one dose of study medication and had efficacy measurements at both baseline and post-baseline. Last observation carried forward.

outcome.title: Maximum Plasma Concentrations (Cmax) of Sildenafil and Sildenafil's Metabolite, UK-103,320
outcome.description: Maximum plasma concentrations was calculated from the observed value of plasma concentrations in each participant

group.title: Sildenafil:Pharmacokinetic Analysis Participant
group.description: Consists of participants who received sildenafil monotherapy, without administration of other treatment drugs for pulmonary arterial hypertension, in Part I or II, and satisfied the inclusion criteria for pharmacokinetics evaluation without violating the exclusion criteria. The participants were treated with sildenafil 20 mg three times a day orally in Part I period(12 weeks) and Part II period (longterm treatment period, until a proper system was established to provide sildenafil to participants after approval for the indication of pulmonary arterial hypertension).

measure.title: Maximum Plasma Concentrations (Cmax) of Sildenafil and Sildenafil's Metabolite, UK-103,320
measure.description: Maximum plasma concentrations was calculated from the observed value of plasma concentrations in each participant

outcome.title: Time to First Occurrence of Maximum Plasma Concentrations (Tmax) of Sildenafil and Sildenafil's Metabolite, UK-103,320
outcome.description: Time to first occurrence of maximum plasma concentrations were calculated from the observed value of plasma concentrations in each participant.

group.title: Sildenafil:Pharmacokinetic Analysis Participant
group.description: Consists of participants who received sildenafil monotherapy, without administration of other treatment drugs for pulmonary arterial hypertension, in Part I or II, and satisfied the inclusion criteria for pharmacokinetics evaluation without violating the exclusion criteria. The participants were treated with sildenafil 20 mg three times a day orally in Part I period(12 weeks) and Part II period (longterm treatment period, until a proper system was established to provide sildenafil to participants after approval for the indication of pulmonary arterial hypertension).

measure.title: Time to First Occurrence of Maximum Plasma Concentrations (Tmax) of Sildenafil and Sildenafil's Metabolite, UK-103,320
measure.description: Time to first occurrence of maximum plasma concentrations were calculated from the observed value of plasma concentrations in each participant.

outcome.title: The Area Under the Curve (AUC) From Time 0 to Time 8 Hour of Sildenafil and Sildenafil's Metabolite, UK-103,320
outcome.description: The area under the curve from time 0 to time 8 hour was calculated from area under the curve in each perticipant on the date of blood sampling using the linear/log trapezoidal rule

group.title: Sildenafil:Pharmacokinetic Analysis Participant
group.description: Consists of participants who received sildenafil monotherapy, without administration of other treatment drugs for pulmonary arterial hypertension, in Part I or II, and satisfied the inclusion criteria for pharmacokinetics evaluation without violating the exclusion criteria. The participants were treated with sildenafil 20 mg three times a day orally in Part I period(12 weeks) and Part II period (longterm treatment period, until a proper system was established to provide sildenafil to participants after approval for the indication of pulmonary arterial hypertension).

measure.title: The Area Under the Curve (AUC) From Time 0 to Time 8 Hour of Sildenafil and Sildenafil's Metabolite, UK-103,320
measure.description: The area under the curve from time 0 to time 8 hour was calculated from area under the curve in each perticipant on the date of blood sampling using the linear/log trapezoidal rule

outcome.title: The Average Plasma Concentration (Css,av) of Sildenafil at Steady State
outcome.description: The average plasma concentration of sildenafil at steady state was calculated from the area under the curve from time 0 to 8 hour/dosing interval (8 hours).

group.title: Sildenafil:Pharmacokinetic Analysis Participant
group.description: Consists of participants who received sildenafil monotherapy, without administration of other treatment drugs for pulmonary arterial hypertension, in Part I or II, and satisfied the inclusion criteria for pharmacokinetics evaluation without violating the exclusion criteria. The participants were treated with sildenafil 20 mg three times a day orally in Part I period(12 weeks) and Part II period (longterm treatment period, until a proper system was established to provide sildenafil to participants after approval for the indication of pulmonary arterial hypertension).

measure.title: The Average Plasma Concentration (Css,av) of Sildenafil at Steady State
measure.description: The average plasma concentration of sildenafil at steady state was calculated from the area under the curve from time 0 to 8 hour/dosing interval (8 hours).

outcome.title: The Average Plasma Trough Concentration (Ctrough) of Sildenafil
outcome.description: The average plasma trough concentration of sildenafil was calculated from the observed value before administration of the drug in each participants.

group.title: Sildenafil:Pharmacokinetic Analysis Participant
group.description: Consists of participants who received sildenafil monotherapy, without administration of other treatment drugs for pulmonary arterial hypertension, in Part I or II, and satisfied the inclusion criteria for pharmacokinetics evaluation without violating the exclusion criteria. The participants were treated with sildenafil 20 mg three times a day orally in Part I period(12 weeks) and Part II period (longterm treatment period, until a proper system was established to provide sildenafil to participants after approval for the indication of pulmonary arterial hypertension).

measure.title: The Average Plasma Trough Concentration (Ctrough) of Sildenafil
measure.description: The average plasma trough concentration of sildenafil was calculated from the observed value before administration of the drug in each participants.

outcome.title: Laboratory Test Abnormalities (Without Regard to Baseline Abnormality)
outcome.description: The total number of participants with laboratory test abnormalities without regard to baseline abnormality.
outcome.population: All subjects who received at least one dose of the study medication and had any evaluable laboratory test data after treatment.

group.title: Sildenafil: Part I and Part II
group.description: Consists of participants who entered the study from Part I period plus participants who entered the study from Part II period.

measure.title: Laboratory Test Abnormalities (Without Regard to Baseline Abnormality)
measure.description: The total number of participants with laboratory test abnormalities without regard to baseline abnormality.
measure.population: All subjects who received at least one dose of the study medication and had any evaluable laboratory test data after treatment.

group.title: Sildenafil: Part I and Part II
group.description: Consists of participants who entered the study from Part I period plus participants who entered the study from Part II period.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of < 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), < 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential info other than study results.
